title: Probability of Selection: Candy Bar Weight
question_text:
Suppose a certain brand of candy bar has a mean weight of $1.02\text{ oz}$ with a standard deviation of $0.03\text{ oz}$.
Determine the probability of randomly selecting $5$ candy bars that have an average weight of $1\text{ oz}$ or less.
solution:
In this situation, we use the formula below, where $n = 5$, $x = 1$, $µ = 1.02$, and $σ = 0.03$, to find a $z$-score of $-1.49$:

$$\text{Standard Score:} = z =\dfrac{\bar{x} - \mu}{\frac{\sigma}{\sqrt(n)}}$$

We then use the standard normal chart to find $p(z<-1.49) = 0.0681$.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'D'.
